text:
Good morning team, I hope you are doing well.
Is there any chance to get the number of tickets assigned to a HubSpot user for a specific pipeline?
Hello everyone, i have a question, can i make my own mock-data for a child theme that i've created??
hi, you can just filter from HubSpot UI. or do you need to get this information in another way?

Hey all,

Just starting out with HubSpot and creating some campaign landing pages.
I've selected a basic template from the initial list - <https://prnt.sc/1HyO-Jb2hSmQ>

However it is pretty restrictive. It doesn't allow me to edit the HTML of Rich text modules. => <https://prnt.sc/3_rBfOXnyI4s>

Is there any way to duplicate this template to circumvent this restriction?
I've looked around in the Design Tools section but I see no clue on where this template is.

Can you help me out here please?

On a separate note:
I wanted to create a new rich text module I could use in above said template in order to be able to have custom fonts for rich text.
I cloned the default rich text one and added the font to the CSS.
My difficulty is that I don't know how to make this module available in templates.
Can you please give some guidance here also please? <https://prnt.sc/7_P11nveo9PA>
I need it via API or WF, because I want to create a WF to auto-assign tickets if the number of tickets per agent is lower than 5

Hi guys, I want to have a transparent video with webm format used in a client's website and at the moment the video is working good for all browsers except safari, has anybody had similar issues before on how to fix this problem for safari ?

Hey peeps

Do you know if drag and drop templates are supported in Blog Listing Pages in HubSpot?
I know Blog Post Pages can

How can we do this in react? Get the blog title or content title?

in hubl for example it did this:

for the blog title:
set blog = blog_by_id(item.url.content_id)
set title = blog.html_title

for the content title:
set content = content_by_id(item.url.content_id)
set title = content.title

Hi fellas,

I am wondering if there is an existing app to connect SharePoint with HubSpot. I know there is an app called CloudFiles, but are there other options to attach both SharePoint files and lists into a contact record?

I have done something similar with middleware, <http://make.com|make.com> to be more precise.

They have things called scenarios if you have not used it before. I have 2 scenarios complimenting each other. I think the screenshot is self explanatory what they do.

But I do insert only a link so not sure it will suffice for your use case.

Hey <@U01DQVABFE0>! Thanks for asking your question. In the future, please address this community with a more gender neutral greeting, as there are more than just “fellas” in this community that may be able to assist you. Thanks!
<@UQNEXHW14> Excuse my ignorance, I certainly didn’t mean to exclude anyone. I’m not an english native speaker and I didn’t know that word was specific to a gender.

Thanks <@U01DQVABFE0>! Very much appreciate your response. Informal English terms can be definitely be confusing! For example, you’ll see lots of use of the term “guys” on here which is technically also gendered and not ideal, but not as strictly enforced given its wider acceptance acceptance across all genders. Enough language lessons here, just really appreciate your response and would be happy to delete my feedback if you edit your original post.
